klJbI7nxU0ktXgY4OcWzmA.text: excellent meats, our waitress was hard to understand but the dinner was pretty good. Our Empanadas to start the meal were solid, no surprises there (had the beef and corn ones) and then my churrasscaria lomo was fairly good. Not as tender as as I expected for a marinated steak. As sides the portobello mushrooms tasted great.The ambience reminds me of a cow theme gone awry in an upscale restaurant and the music is a little loud in to have a conversation but the upstairs seemed quieter.

9Lb3GMyC-7UBH8fMQI-6hg.text: If you like steak then Gaucho is the place for you. It's not just the steak that's great, but that delicious cheesy bread they serve at the start always gets my juices going. the cocktails are great too. I think it's a great place for a special occasion but with some of the cuts costing £30 a piece without sides or drinks it's pretty hefty otherwise.

zupQ6cffNYnQmtN33LdU6w.text: Decorated like a goth's wet dream. This is uber masculine design. Consisting entirely of blacks, mirrors and the odd flashes of cow, the room disorientates at first, black doors open onto black rooms through black walls, until you manage to pick out the shades. The crowd in the place is similarly male, a slightly confused couple sat next to us slotted uneasily next to large groups of braying men, flushed of face with bonhomie, wine, good steak and self importance. Deals weren't being done, but like Keens and the grand old tradition of New York steakhouses, they were certainly being celebrated.It didn't start well for for the restaurant service wise I have to say.. We sat in the (black) departure lounge of the bar and sipped insipid cocktails. I went for the Bloody Asado, a watery £8's worth of roasted plum tomato, red pepper and vodka, reminiscent of a very cheap salsa. 45 minutes after our reservation time we were still sat there. The location and the crowd would suggest they are focussed firmly on the volume business market and a random three top is of less interest.We finally sat down at a table an hour and 15 after our reservation. The urgent need now was for food and fast so we skipped the starters and got straight in. For the record, the starters have always been a hit in the past. Fresh fish ceviche and tiraditos are bright and clean, served straight up with lime and lemon, the citric acid 'cooking' the meat. My guest and I looked no further than the Gaucho Sampler, a 1.2kg board of fillet, rump, sirloin and ribeye. The meat arrived served as requested (though identified incorrectly by the server) and was a melting joy. With a bottle of excellently chosen Malbec, recommended by the server (one bright spot was their wine training) the meat was exactly what we needed. Moving through the sampler board from cleanest (fillet) to most complex (ribeye) flavours I was amazed by how clearly the differences in cut shone through when served alongside each other. It's a must do experience for the steak lover. Sides were largely forgettable (and incorrect).Ultimately you're here for the meat, and probably business. If you're looking for a great steak experience in London then go to Hawksmoor or Goodman. If you're looking for an authentic Argentinian steak restaurant, go to Buen Ayre in Broadway Market. If you're bringing your (mainly male) team to celebrate winning a piece of business over a few bottles of Malbec and some decent steak, then the Gaucho will do just fine.

qhvTgisXZO1qcYDuLIT13Q.text: Great steaks, but ridiculously expensive otherwise, especially the wines

MDN6Rp_9YLI7eCfsBLVnwA.text: Love the ambience, love the meat... A bit expensive but worthy

D1pBAkInaFDeEGYheDEGdA.text: Excellent Argentinian steakhouse. The decor is modern and trendy with a great vibe. The staff was incredibly friendly and went out of their way to help us. The skirt steak was mouth wateringly good and the bread buns with cheese delicious. Great place.

C3QpbtntbHuSDTI8IK-C_w.text: Best steak I have ever had. Close to the city with a rather impressive view. The service was excellent and the food totally orgasmic. The wine collection is large and the deserts were the perfect finishing touch to an unbelievably tasty experience.  The place is not cheap but worth every penny.  Definitely recommended.

Rnx6l7SlYhhDERT0nP3VVw.text: If you want a delicious steak, great service, and wine, Gaucho is the place for you. I wouldn't recommend going with a vegetarian. While they do have vegetarian options on the menu the decor is reminiscent of cows with cow skin chairs etc... This is the only good steak I have found in all of England, and that is because it is real Argentinian Beef. Everything was delicious. If you order medium rare, they will come a bit on the rare side, but will be tender and delicious. We ordered chips, spinach, and corn as sides and found it was too much food for us to get through for  2 of us. I would definitely recommend it and hope to go back soon!

lauWtPg0qNPKM4GKLT_zKg.text: If you like eating beef, you'll like Gaucho. This particular franchise of the Gaucho chain has a location that's difficult to beat, in a modern part of town and with panoramic views of the Thames and the beautiful Tower Bridge.Gaucho isn't designed for vegetarians. It's all about meat here, and cow flesh in particular. Before you choose from the menu, a waiter will present you with the available cuts - large lumps of muscle and fatty tissue on a wooden board, which has been known to dribble a trail of cold blood onto the table. They leave the fur on the leather upholstery which generously covers the chairs, walls and indeed various other surfaces, and I'd wager that the interior-designer intentionally selected skins from breeds of beef cattle decorated with the most characteristically bovine of patterns. It's barbaric, really. It's a celebration and flaunting the sacrificial act of killing and eating another animal. Do modern Homo sapiens really need to do kill inferior species in order to eat? I recommend the sirloin or fillet cuts, and also the burger. Moo.The wine list is clearly intended to impress -- which it succeeds in doing. Incidentally, during my last visit I found one of the best red wines I've tasted in a while. I don't usually drink red wine, but this variety was recommended to me and the colour does somehow seem to match the overall theme of blood and red meat. I'll update this review with details when I find the note I made. I'm afraid I'd had rather a lot of the stuff by the time it came to choosing a safe place to file my note.

znOoWNDmOLrx4C5b7RK-nQ.text: It's a really nice place with fantastic views to Tower Bridge. The service was amazing good and all the different steaks were shown and explained before we ordered. Never have eaten a similar good steak. Very recommendable.

qlE5EAJbO4aRn_HzCA2hpQ.text: It's a chain, but it's a damn fine chain.They've got their own beers (lager, unfortunately), and it's not cheap, but anything on the menu is good.Then they do that thing where they show you the meat you're going to eat in its raw, wriggling (after spending a fine old time hanging).Proper old school steakhouse wiht definitely non-local meat... but it's damn good. I on wish you had a better river view.But the steak's where it's at.

iLpdygFcUVP-OnN0t-LJvg.text: Wasn't impressed. Eaten at steak houses all over the world and this one was a distant what the hell did I pay for that?!? The appetizer of chorizo was amazing, but they really messed up the steak. I've paid equivalent prices in American steakhouses and didn't have to saw on it nearly as much as this place. People mean well, but be prepared to enjoy the atmosphere and ask for your steak well done. Sorry, it's true. Not an "avoid", but I feel like I got taken. Service was professional and as it should be. Very impressed with staff.

9ykbeKFldex_gnM7-C9RYQ.text: The other reviewers have already gone into great detail, so I'll just quickly share my story... My first Gaucho experience was at the one in Canary Wharf and it was a revelation! Amazing steak (I had the medallion filet which is so juicy and flavorful I didn't really use my sauce) and amazing side dishes (loved them all except for the fries/chips). Everyone at the table loved the little warm cheese rolls that come with bread... so much that they would have been happy to eat nothing but that all night!I was so annoyed that it had taken me nearly a year living in London to discover Gaucho... that I went again the next night! I came to this one because I love the area right by the river and Tower Bridge near the really cool ultra-modern glass buildings. I had the marinated ribeye (Churrasco) but ended up preferring the filet better.

wgBSlL75dgXAZ1Cd4kmwQQ.text: Location is unbeatable, meat was actually ok, for some strange reasons i had a way better steak at this Gaucho then the one in Swallow street...guess i got lucky :)List of whines is comprehensive and staff friendly. I'd definitely go back.

vAqhfRZKGLyE8T3Gv1I4IQ.text: Very good meat, nice atmosphere, and very professional and friendly service. But this comes at a price - this place is not exactly a bargain! Nevertheless, if you want to treat yourself to an excellent Argentine steak, this is a good place to go. This branch (i.e. near Tower Bridge) also has very nice London views..

N_vHS_KE6rb1LjxQiVYBKQ.text: Service here is generally good, the steaks are generally excellent.  OK it's a chain, but it's a good chain.  If you like steak come here and expect to come out weighing another two or three pounds having spent around eighty (and the same again on each of your companions).A great location, good food, somehow a little indulgent.

zCZMxbqQzG41dgOByPU5GA.text: My bosses LOVE Gaucho's, so I usually end up eating at one of their locations while in London.  Which works for me because it's always an excellent meal, made even better because I don't have to pay.I think it's the Broadgate location that has the giant glass cube.  It's fun to have a drink there in the comfort behind the glass while watching everyone walk by outside in the rain and wind.  But this location along the river is my favorite because if your reservation is for the 2nd floor along the window, you get a spectacular view of Tower Bridge.  I think it's a little odd that they bring the platter of raw meat out to your table so you can choose your cut, but I'm from Texas and it's required by law for us to be experts in beef cuts.  My favorite is the filet, so that's what I generally order.  The meat is so melt in your mouth tender here that you don't even need a proper steak knife.  Order some shareable sides like spinach, mushrooms, and potatoes and of course a nice bottle (or 2) of Malbec, and you're guaranteed to have a fabulous dinner.My only problem is that some of my coworkers order their steak well done.  It's already dead people - no need to kill it again!  Medium or medium rare will do when you are at a nice steakhouse.

-0egFRaOAFVK0saG1GswAQ.text: Sometimes I believe there's a force in the Universe that just pushed you in a direction you are destined to go.Prior to us heading to London for our friend's wedding, I spent quite a bit of time trying to find a really good restaurant for my wife and I to eat at on our first night there.  After many hours of reading reviews and other recommendations, I chose Gaucho but the original location I was looking at was booked solid, so I saw that they had some other locations and saw that this one was pretty open for a Thursday night.  Sometimes that makes me stop and think on whether or not that's a good sign, but I ploughed ahead and said, "well, it won't be our last meal".I had no idea that this is basically at the foot of our offices in London and that several of my fellow co-workers eat here regularly when they are in London on business.  What a great find.We arrived early and although our table was ready the hostess offered us the chance to settle in with a drink in the small bar area.  Absolutely.Right around our reservation time, she came and got us and brought us to our table in the front window.  Usually I don't like those especially on really cold nights (with huge glass windows) but the view of Tower Bridge from there, light up nicely is really really cool.We started off with some Empanadas which were pretty good.  Not the best I've had but nonetheless, a good beginner.I ordered the Bife de Lomo (Filet Mignon) and MK ordered the Bife Ancho which is the Ribeye.  I added in a peppercorn sauce and we both ordered the sweet potato chips w/chorizo.Steaks were perfectly cooked and the chips were very good although I could have used a bit more chorizo in there.For drinks, MK was tasting several of the drinks of the day and I stuck with their house Pilsner (Rocio).  We were stuffed otherwise we would have loved getting dessert.Restaurant was very attentive at calling us a taxi while we were still at the table but there's not really a good place for the taxi to pick you up as this is deep into that office complex and close to the River Thames.  But we made do just the same.

EYjefqhA3AQ2HWTPL20uTQ.text: Great place to eat for celebratory-type events. Waiters show flavorful cuts of meat to you within minutes of sitting down, explaining the seasonings and giving those who have not had the experience a good glimpse into the meal to come.Their bread basket comes with a dish of oil, brown bread, and small cheese-puff bread with a tapioca interior consistency, salty and flavorful. Empanadas are baked, not fried. The grilled palmito and shrimp salad is fresh and crisp. Kitchen area is set up in the back of the restaurant, in the modern style that is common for higher end restaurants nowadays, so if you really are fascinated enough, you can peek over at the cooks sweating over their grill (hopefully not onto your food).In my brief stint working in London, I liked to alternate between the bife de lomo (beef fillet cut) and the churrasco cuts, (pre-marinated beef spiral cuts). Depends on whether I want my own sauce with the fillet, or feeling like their churrasco sauce. Spinach and/or potatoes with chorizo round out my main.Drinks are stellar -- their specialty cocktail menu is very tasty as well, with drinks that combine cachaca, gin, vidka, etc... even a fairly decent selection of whiskey for those who hunger for a true "steakhouse" combination.I miss thee Gaucho, and thy heavenly cuts of beef.

paJ5wP7B9elURp_NG6VB8A.text: Where to go for a business lunch, why not Gauchos? I've been many times pre my yelp days, so I'll give you a bit of a rundown what it's all about first. This is a chain that have popped up in London the last 10 years or so and it follows a leather and cow-skin interior and a high class food and service standard. My view is that this is a great establishment for business or a group of rowdy guys having a nice dinner out. Nothing that you want to bring a date, girlfriend or wife to for a romantic dinner, as even if the food is good and the service is great, it's still not romantic (except if your date is a raging meatist or gets turned on by the cheer cost).  Gaucho, the word is loosely equivalent to the north American "cowboy" and refers to the rural cattle herders in south America. So, in short, if you are a veggie, stay way clear and this is not the place for you as it is a feast in cow meat. The location of this Gauchos is perfect for an 'London experience', it views over Tower Bridge, and with window seats (as we had), a clear evening and then the lights from the bridge makes it 'picture pretty' view. Before they come and take your order they show up at your table with a big board with the meats they offer (no, not pictures, pieces of the actual meat) and explain the differences and how they are best cooked based around the cut and amount of fat in it. You order your meat, size (in grams before cooked), side dishes (the meat is meat only, no chips and such are on the plate by default) and any starters etc So, now my visit... went there last night meeting up a few friends I've been working with over the years. We meet up at lunch time and started on the "complimentary" bread rolls, the small bread rolls (4-5cm across) are absolutely divine as they have been baked in a way that gives them a crispy shell and in them the bread has been mixed with cheese making them so nice you can eat just those for dinner (careful though, I suspect these bad boys aren't for anyone on a diet... that's why they are so good!). For starter we had a couple of sausage platters, a perfect start on the meat feast we were to embark upon. The platters had a selection of different Argentinean sausage and each of those were perfectly made (no supermarket knockoffs here). For main I ordered one of the marinated cuts (that had been marinated at least 24 hours) cooked to medium rare. We also ordered a set of side dishes for the table, rather do our owns, it works out best that way as you then get to taste all of them rather then get stuck with something you might not enjoy too much... we also got a couple of bottles of wine for the table, please note, that most likely by mistake the waiter did bring the wrong wine at first and if you spend 77 quid a pop you want to make sure you get what you pay for. The meat was cooked to perfection, tasted amazing and the sides accompanied the meat perfectly... same as always, an excellent food experience and in good company an unforgettably moment in time. The time rolled on, we ended up discussions on life and for dessert we shared a couple of cheese platters. The cheeses was well selected but nothing that you wouldn't get elsewhere. Normally they serve it with some chutney, but they forgot to tell us that it wasn't available as they had run out. The head waiter, an very service mined and friendly girl proposed that we could get a glass of port each as a substitute to the chutney, we gladly accepted and she saved the whole experience to end up in a big disappointment. We then, ended the lunch with a couple of drinks each, I had a Gin & Tonic, and lastly we left almost 6 hours after we had arrived. Yes the staff changed mid through from lunch to dinner and at some moments we were the only guests. An unforgettable experience and I'm sure to be back...

ygNe9YeRjaEzOOjBtUIerA.text: In those dark dark days before the Hawksmoor opened, I considered Gaucho arguably one of the best steaks in London. Whilst it's no longer my go-to place for beef, it's still a really consistently good franchise.Staff upon arrival were cheery and helpful. Rocking up at the last minute without knowing the management of a busy restaurant invariably results in killing time at the bar drinking beer (the delightful Rocio Gold, which I still haven't seen anywhere else besides Gaucho). After a short wait we were escorted to our table and greeted by our waiter - professional, friendly and efficient, as their staff usually are.Delightful breads and chimichurri arrived, the most enjoyable of which are their pao de quiejo (little cheese buns) which, if you catch them fresh out of the oven, are about as mind-blowing as a night with Jessica Alba. Oh how I wish I could actually support that comparison with evidence ...Food here is mainly focused on lovely Argentinean beef - there are some reasonable looking alternatives, but no-one really comes here for anything but steak. It's like going to McDonald's for a salad, or a fish restaurant for a steak. Or Angus Steak House for something resembling actual food.Steaks are available in varying sizes to cater to even the most substantial appetite. Their beef is good quality and always makes for a perfectly respectable meal. Not the best steak in town, but definitely a good performer. A current special of fillet with bacon and stilton was solid if a little sparse on the stilton, and at £37 is on the pricey side, especially as it was only 300g. Usually I'd expect to be paying circa £30.Sides of crisp fries and perfectly-cooked lemony spinach made a delightful accompaniment to round out the meal. Throw in a bottle of Luigi Bosca Malbec on this occasion, from their narrow but deep wine list (all Argentinean if I recall correctly, but a great selection), and we were on to a winner. Ultimately, if you want a good steak in London, there are slightly better choices, but Gaucho usually has a table (with a short wait at worst) and you're rarely more than 15 minutes away from one when in Central or the Docklands, and it's a perfectly good night out.

8dbLkVZ6miK7Sg7p6B0cOA.text: Loved the picana medium cooked, beef and chicken empanadas

uA_HIqlEf4n6jz6f82bXxg.text: My hosts found out I love meat and am South American, so they brought me here and I love them for it :)  As soon as you walk in, you know you're in for a treat.  First, the smell of roasted beef completely envelopes you in a blanket of sheer bovine pleasure. Second,  the hostess is very welcoming and the service is great. The restaurant is very moody, it's dark, covered in dark brown leather, cow hide accents here and there, black ceiling, modern crystal chandeliers, it just puts you in the mood for beef.  4 of us split the Guacho Sampler, it came with sirloin, fillet, rump and rib eye, done a perfect medium.For sides we got the hand cut chips, they are topped with sea salt, garlic and herbs...addictive! The sweet peas with bacon lardons (fresh thick cut ham chunks - my translation) and mixed salad with a simple vinaigrette.  All of it tasted fresh and delicious.  My mouth is starting to water as I write this.  We washed it all down with a couple bottles of Malbec, oh the sweet nectar.  Awesome meal.

-4kPYDfznwD_Ncf4GBAWhA.text: Incredible, incredible view.  Make a reservation for 8pm and ask for a table next to the window on the 2nd floor.  Just amazing.  Great service and the food is pretty good (not amazing).  The steak is flavorful, rich, and well aged, but it doesn't have that 1500 degree broiler crust that I love.  The sides were standard.  The dessert was pretty good.

gFeJ_sCZlQdz6sJ-LM8UfQ.text: my burger was great actually and the ambiance is quite nice...butttt service was subpar and we got stuff added to our bill which we never ordered :s

Ctp9NU8fJmgP_kV7MT-XUQ.text: The food, atmosphere, and views - all amazing!! The steaks were cooked to perfection, and their cheese bread (chipas?) Is to die for! The view of tower bridge is icing on the cake!

chL0c8y8KIrXbz7b4X9tag.text: What a treat!  Our only extravagant dinner while in London and it did not disappoint!  Filet churrasco was delicious and cooked perfectly. The ribeye chimichurri was also out of this world.  It was not cooked correctly the first time, but they more than made up for that, going the extra mile to make it right.  Monica, our server was knowledgeable and so friendly.  Great recommendations on the steak.  The cab/Tempranillo blend was excellent.  On top of everything, we forgot to print our E tickets to the ceremony of the keys!  They graciously allowed us to email them the file and printed and it for us.  Now that's service!

lUw9UZXLgfaferYylgWKHA.text: Very, very good meal. Great staff and a nice atmosphere. Quick kitchen, a wide range of food choices, lovely decor. Would highly recommend trying this Argentinian restaurant. Views of the tower bridge topped it all off!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Cheese cauliflower
Photo of Gaucho - Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Trio taster plate

fnNEIJdKvPJaL81pJLLR6Q.text: This is a difficult one.. I think the trick is if you like medium rare like me, then make sure you ask for rare, if you like well done then ask for medium, etc.The starters were lovely, the staff were really lovely, the cocktail I had was OK not great. The waiter didn't give us a menu as he kind of offered us whatever we wanted which was nice but it would have been good to know what they had available. The mains were disappointing sadly, my boyfriend had the fillet in breadcrumbs which tasted lovely but was a bit dry. I had the trio of medallions which I asked for medium rare: the fillet was cooked medium and very dry for a fillet, which I expected to be the best cut, the sirloin(?) was cooked well done, I can't really explain how well done it was! I had to tell the waiter which I never like to do, but he happily replaced this medallion for me with a perfectly medium rare one, the rump looked medium rare to the eye but was really crispy on the outside and the texture was quite dry, tasted like medium.The sauces were amazing the garlic oil and the chimichurri, we were nicely full so didn't have desserts. The broccoli was a nice vegetable side. Overall it was a very expensive bill over £100 which I wouldn't normally mind for really good steak, but I left a little disappointed. I'm glad we tried gaucho as we love to have steak everywhere! but I'm not sure we would come here again :(

JNXxYuZP9Mb-7HobGJWKuA.text: Hands down, the best steak I've ever had.Awesome service, unique dining experience, fantastic ambiance, and phenomenal drinks/cocktails.Next time I'm across the pond, dinner at Gaucho's is definitely on the agenda.

DcowdlTrElmjUQcZDRZblw.text: Wandered in with no preconceived expectations.  First the view of tower bridge during dinner was simply spectacular from our second floor table.  Our waiter claudio was really excellent with a deep knowledge of the wine list and the menu offerings and his recommendations were well thought out. He also didn't hesitate to offer a sample of a wine if we were not 100% convinced. Finally the manager Monica was fully switched on and fully engaged and clearly on top of what was going on in the restaurant.

waNJuMKl3_fsZg-ycDbSnQ.text: I love a good piece of steak! Gaucho is my favorite steak house in London. I am usually not a fan of chain restaurants, but Gaucho does chain well. All locations have similar theme, but each also has its own charm. This location is right on The River Thames and you have a gorgeous view of the Tower Bridge. Enjoy a nice juicy steak with a view, now you can't beat that! The menu is quite big and definitely brings a lot of South American flavors: they offer a variety of Ceviche (raw fish marinated in lime juicy), empanadas (Baked dumpling), and steak with chimichurri sauce. As enticing as all the starters and mains sound, I come here usually for nothing but the steak. I love the way they help you pick your meat. Different cuts of raw beef are presented on a cutting board and the server will explain to you what cut it is, what the flavor profile is, and how much you should order. You can have a piece as small as small as 225g or as big as 800g! Since I love my meat marbled, so I always go with rib-eye. It is not a cheap meal, but it is totally worth the money.

ZErQm34_Lt-EPILPUHSUmg.text: The cow skins on the walls are a sure sign that it's all about the beef.I've been to other Gaucho's in London (the one off Oxford street, which seems considerably larger), but I visited this one for the first time the other day.  If you're in the City, it's pretty convenient to just pop over Tower Bridge and enjoy the beautiful setting by the river.Food-wise, the menu is a little one dimensional -- think "beef" -- even to the point that we didn't order starters because it felt like having the beef and then the beef.  Do you really want to tee-up a steak main course with a sausage platter or beef tamales?  Not me.  That said, there was a full range of ceviche, but we just weren't in the mood.The wine list is also a bit one dimensional, but happily that dimension is largely Malbec.  I can't remember which one we had (sorry) but it was stellar.Steak-wise, here's my strong advice:  get the Churrasco de Cuadril.  You'll save some money relative to the other steaks -- the "lomo" (i.e., filet) is twice the price -- but I like the basic marinated rump steak the best.

wL5P2sGqVC3APtn2ADQhkA.text: Came for the lunch menu and while my colleagues enjoyed their meals I was left very underwhelmed. The 3 course menu was good value and the starter and dessert were enjoyable the portion size could have been increased slightly.  The whole experience was ruined by the main course. I requested my steak medium rare and when it arrived it looked as though it had barely been into a warm pan. No one arrived to check on how our meals were for quite a while and by the time someone came I was out of time although they did suggest sending it back to the kitchen for additional cooking.  Not really an experience I'm in a rush to repeat

sJq0Mn2dPPVBCT16OjlFtg.text: Did I die and go to heaven? By far best steak I've ever had. So soft you could cut it with a butter knife. It's candlelit with chandeliers and an Argentina flare with the decor. I loved this place and would definitely go back if I ever got the chance!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Empanadas de queso y carne
Photo of Gaucho - Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom. Starter

v-nQazTv65LH2Tuu7VNzww.text: Should really be a two but the view gets it a three. All their beef is Argentinian which I've had in Brazil. Idk if it's because Argentina is a LONG ways for London but I was not impressed with their steaks. My ribeye was thin and not very wide for its weight. Service was lack luster. Waiter spilled olive oil as he was placing the bread down and took a while to take a drink order.  Sides were small for the price and pretty sure the green beans were under cooked. Stems were also still on (not sure if that's acceptable here). Oh and what kind of steak house doesn't give you steak knives??

CU5o3SRyw8s22QROKxMU1w.text: Went on a Tuesday night with work colleagues and was treated to an amazing seat with a view of the Tower Bridge.  The server was knowledgeable explaining all of the different cuts and promptly filled our wine glasses when they were two-thirds empty.  The food was amazing; I went with the skirt steak, which is not your typical order at a steak place but I knew if they cooked it the right way it wouldn't be tough or flavorless like some skirt can be if not done properly.  It was also seasoned with oil, garlic, and another spice which gave it amazing flavor.  They cooked it perfectly to the point I didn't need a steak knife to slice it; the dinner knife did just fine.  The sides were good, although somewhat limited.  If I had any complaint at all, it would be that the side options aren't very expansive.  The wine list was large and included many of the labels and blends that complement steak, but not too large which I think is fine for a steak house.  Larger selections tend to make you feel there are lesser quality selections lurking in there so you have to pay extra attention.  The final bill puts a scare into you for a split second, but with quality meat, wine, views, and service like this you can justify it.

nOZWbaULMux6qdmx5vplxw.text: The one star is for the service. Went there last week  ordered a ribeye steak medium. The steak came out well done brown through out. I sent it back and next steak came back blood raw. Sent the next one back as it came back well this time. The fourth came medium rare but at that time I was so hungry I just ate it.   I am used to American steak houses that cook it right the first time. Spent $50 on the worst steak I ever had. Learned my lesson only American steak houses from now on.

RVyRde-CTfb3bmMrlRolTw.text: This was one of our highlights when visiting London. We had several starters to share, including the sausages, seafood sampler and the ham and mozzarella pockets. Starters were wonderfully paired with a glass of Piedra Ceraza 2015. As a Pinot Noir it paired with starters without overpowering the dishes. Wine pairings for starters and mainstream were requested by the glass and our server was quick to recommended a choice of pairings of very good Argentinian wines. Mains was a ribeye with anchovy butter. Great combination on a medium rare steak with good marveling. Good wine pairing again with a Gran Lurton  Cabernet Sauvignon 2011, enough wood in the wine to clear the palate without drowning out the flavour of the meat. I preferred this choice to the malbec on offer. While still a great wine it was too heavy. Desert included cheese cake and chocolate mouse. I can say without hesitation that everything from the breads to the desert showed great planning and foresight and was executed superbly.

8hT1ktyMdPtZur4lxadEBQ.text: Me and a few work colleagues decided on this place for a lunchtime treat, the place looks good, staff are friendly and the food was OK, a nice steak cooked medium rare (although I asked for it rare). One of my colleagues was not impressed as his steak was rare and not medium rare ( so could have swapped, but was too late by the time we realised), the staff did offer to cook it further which was nice but we were tight on time. The dessert was nice. Overall not too bad but wasn't impressed with the portion sizes or lack of accompaniments. Won't rush back.

zl3i9iv02pqlC7mblVkVZg.text: Great location, great interiors, great views, great food!  We will definitely be back the next time we visit London.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

AeVnp_fEnvKjmgvzpJ8wXA.text: Visited this restaurant for a company dinner. We were warmly greeted with mulled wine while we waited for coats and bags to be checked and to be seated. Nice touch! We were seated at a nice windowside table with a spectacular view of the Towerbridge! The ceviche sampler appetizer was amazing. Highly recommended. All of the steaks look amazing and the sirloin I had was pretty good, four out of five stars for the steak. Service was good and attentive. Not the best or the quickest but totally fine.

CpSOmpX6BUIj4OlT_IbUuQ.text: The view is the best thing about this place as my favourite site in London is Tower Bridge. Wow. The steak is excellent. I had the rib eye. We had raw fish for starter, cheesecake for desert ( which was s bit too sickly for my taste and the biscuit was too soft, I like my biscuit to be biscuit) the desert wine was lovely as was our melbeck. The white Russian cocktails were also fabulous.

qq134wJulvH4uBFurmEx-g.text: The best steak I have ever had in London, and amazing views to complement it. The staff even threw in a complementary glass of bubbly seeing as we were there for a birthday celebration. Lovely sides as well (especially the corn one) and an overall lovely experience.

ofx8ikVdw4hVwETMHwl1AQ.text: It's a good steakhouse chain with some snazzy interior details. The steak is somewhere between good and great -- it's not the mind blowing religious experience one occasionally has with a perfect cut of meat, but it's flawless and tasty. The apps are interesting I suppose, though the civiche was just a little too far from what I'm used to for my taste (and also not sufficiently seasoned -- though that's admittedly a matter of taste)The wine list is fantastic -- ahh, malbec. The service was a tad meh. Reasonably attentive and helpful, just not exceptional.The atmosphere wasn't really my vibe.

Qw1uR0KYGoaMVifvnCdI9w.text: Very pretty and trendy inside. Professional and friendly service. The speciality is beef. Cooked just as requested. Good flavors.

ioWQ215Wbd518SCSZuBErQ.text: Don't bother. Highly overpriced for what you get. Empanadas are not really Argentinian style, the meat is fair quality, and the service too slow. Dulce de Leche Cheese cake, really??? A traditional cheese cake doesn't match with dulce de leche, and Dulce de Leche is for a plain cake or a crepe. Please don't mix them, they're perfect by their own. And yes, I'm Argentinian BTW.Two stars instead of one, because of the nice atmosphere.

tWABqi1F31tcAXGje3JHpw.text: Overpriced for what they serve. We enjoyed the tasting menu of corn soup, delicious steak, charming dessert, pairing it with a tasty Argentine wine. Food is excellent, service fine, but it is not fantastic enough to justify the price point. We will not return.

mtGUBHzUysNpCVR8hBYJPw.text: Man oh man ABSOLUTELY amazing! Made reservations about 3-4 days before and requested a view of the tower bridge when we went on our trip to London. Got to the area about a hour or two before our reservations and they had a whole outdoor extravaganza with little truck bars opened up service awesome drinks while taking in the amazing views. Got to the restaurant our table was ready for us which had an amazingggg view of tower bridge (which the table was not guaranteed with this view) started off with some bottles of wine and appetizers and as we selected our meats they bring the meats out to you and show you the marbling on the meat itself and go over in detail about the meat before bringing it out. Some of the juiciest steaks I've ever had. Amazing service amazing food amazing view. Should book another trip to London just for Gaucho.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

1bELCBPbr0sSpCCHaNPJFw.text: This restaurant looks pretty, it's in a great location, seems to be quite popular but I don't think the food is all that, I've definitely had better!The servers are extremely personable and knowledgeable.  The menu is extensive with lots of choices.  The mixed drinks were very well done and the wine list is decent.  You do need to book a table in advance and you can request a table by the window for a good view of tower bridge.I ordered the scallops, they were alright but I can make more delicious scallops at home.  I made the mistake of ordering a steak...I should've known better as I am a Texan and you just cannot get a decent steak in the UK.  I ordered my steak medium with chimichurri sauce, I was served a sirloin steak that was tough, not tender, and that was NOT chimichurri sauce.  The sides were alright but nothing special (mashed potatoes, broccoli, and something served in a corn husk).  The dessert was very good!! Ordered the dulce de leche cheesecake and it was spectacular!  The dessert sampler had a bread pudding (dry), a crumble (boring taste) and a mousse (decent).  The restaurant itself was very pretty, loved the lighting and the seatjn

tUeuGs5DJFV4Gzceey1zUw.text: WORST SERVICE EVER by a server named Renato. This is my first time ever writing a review because I really felt there is a need for it. When I first sat down, I was asked around 10 times whether I wanted still or sparkling water, and I kept answering "please let me wait for my friend while I'll have tap water for the time being." He then kept pushing for some cocktails and wine, and I had to reply with the same answer again. When my friend arrived, he kept asking the same question again, "still or sparkling?" and my friend said "tap water, please". When my friend asked for a refill of tap water, Renato got a bottle of STILL water, opened it behind us, and poured it into my friends cup, when the cup still had half a glass of TAP water. This kind of service shouldn't be allowed at any restaurants, let alone one of Gaucho's price and name. Furthermore, when I was in the moment of putting the last few pieces of steak into my mouth, Renato appears out of nowhere and just takes my plate when I was still holding the fork and knife and ingesting the steak, without even asking me whether I'm done or not. In addition, the main courses came basically right after we finished our starters, and my friend and I didn't even get a chance to relax before we had to deal with our main courses. We went on a Thursday night, and it was quite busy there, and it seems that commission-hungry Renato just wanted us out of the restaurant so he could serve his next customers, and push the next customers for some still water.This dinner would've been better if the food was exceptional, so that the horrible service would be outweighed a bit. But it was not. For the 300g ribeye steak I got, there were bare any char-grilled marks on the steak, and the flavour wasn't what I expected from a steakhouse which is supposedly to be one of the better ones in London. All in all, this was the most unpleasant meal so far I've sad in my trip to London. Yes, it was a nice location by the Tower Bridge, but nothing justifies Renato's shocking service, and having a mediocre steak doesn't help this case at all.I wouldn't recommend anyone going to this restaurant at all. If you must, please avoid the name by the name of Renato.

wOWTI-jz3143Vft8sn5Txw.text: A great evening with magnificent views of the Tower Bridge and the Thames. We were greeted by friendly wait staff, the place was bustling so we had to wait a few minutes for our table. However from the moment we were seated until we left our waiter and the manager were constantly checking on us to make sure we had what we wanted.  The food was excellent. I had the chorizo steak which was done to perfection. Washed it down with a mint julip and then had some warm Argentinian rice pudding for desert.The final damage was a bit eye watering but I think well worth it

5Kh7FP11O19ltjHR_70r5w.text: Ok I'm a fan of Gaucho's having been to a few of them around London. This one by far has the best view, as long as the upstairs is open you will get a great view of Tower Bridge. Unfortunately thew upstairs section was not open for our visit which was a shame as it was a Birthday celebration. It was probably not open as it was a Sunday would be my guess.Upon arrival we were greeted with the usual Gaucho gusto. Coats and bags were taken and we were given the choice of going straight to our table or grab a cocktail first, needless to say the cocktail option won!They have some comfortable seats by the bar in which to take your cocktail. We were given plenty of time to select our drinks, they were made swiftly once we had decided, we had a novice cocktail drinker with us so it took a while.Once we had received our drinks we moved across to our table, we did reject the first table as it offered little to none of the great few outside. Once settled we under went the usual what shall we have debate, the cheese bread is always a must when you visit a Gaucho. After the usual sales pitch from our waitress about the different cuts of meat.The service was to the usual high standard I have come to expect from Gaucho's, the timings of our meal was spot on never waiting to long between courses. Those of us who had steak could not grumble about the quality of the meat and the fact they were cooked exactly as requested.I like Gaucho's and will continue to visit them when I can afford them and if you are reading this it is not a cheap evening out, but worth it in my opinion.

IxIfDvcN7O7LbrzK5REfiA.text: You're basically paying for a view of the tower bridge. They have indoor and outdoor seating and in the inside has pretty cool decor. We only had drinks which were over priced. There weren't many people in the restaurant at the time (midday) yet the staff was hard to get a hold of. May or may not be a good choice depending what you're looking for!

9xEm23ME41UAtemoCqzFzg.text: The Gaucho restaurant is perfectly situation next to Tower Bridge and City Hall. Great location!What caught me right away was the cow hide style chairs inside.  The ambiance is perfect and the staff were amazing to say the least.  They make all the drinks you can want and stuck to the Cabernet Franc, Casarena Laruens Vineyard, from Mendoza.  It was delicious!!Here is what we had for appetizers and what recommend:-Beef Empanadas-Mini Burgers-Shrimp Chicharron-Spanish Mini Pincho-Chorizo Sausage-Tuna CevicheMain Course - I went with their Signature Bife De Ancho (Rib eye served with chimichurri)Im telling you guys, this was really really good.  Had it cooked medium rare and the flavor the sauce and wine just paired wonderfully!Desserts - We all shared the Dulce de leche cheesecake, poached plums and praline chocolate mousse.  All delicious!One thing I wanted to point out which is why I have a 5 star is because their staff is exemplary!They brought to my attention that one of their servers accidentally dropped Bearnaise sauce on the floor next to me and some of it landed on my jacket.  Keep in mind, they didnt have to tell me anything.  They went out of their way and told me, took my jacked and tried their best to clean it on the spot.  Took some off but since it was dark couldnt really say the other areas on my dark suit coat.  One of the owners, Milena came to me and said to get it dry cleaned and they would take care of the bill.This is what I call "best in breed" customer service!!!  Bravo!  I am back home in the US now and they have issued me a re-reimbursement of the laundry bill to have the stains removed from my jacket!  Well done!Not only was the food and wine superb, their customer service and follow up are exemplary!Thank you to the Gaucho staff for showing my team such a good time and for wonderful experience.  Look forward to visiting theme when I travel across the pond!

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Gaucho - Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

EAN1SoAD0mIJbfgMrsORGg.text: If you're looking for amazing food, great customer service, and beautiful views Gaucho Tower Bridge is the restaurant to choose. We had an opportunity to preorder our meal upon making the reservations. This allowed the staff to accommodate our party of twelve seamlessly. They had everything ready for us from the moment we stepped into the restaurant. The atmosphere was just what we needed to set the stage for the remainder of our evening. In my opinion they understand the importance of tailoring to their customers needs.

FSIwalTm8D5ZsFm4sO7Etg.text: Great food: the steaks are truly delicious! Great service as well, and nice indoor seating area. Not too much noise either

LcHE2l7ic_61sMZqybHQaA.text: Great location and good food!Had sunday lunch, roasted beef that came with appetizer and dessert.  Very tasty and great service. Oddly the appetiser was Italian Arancini at argentinean steak house but was tasty.  The english dessert , merengue with cream and berries was good.Looking oveer the bridge tower. Pretty awesome.

vWbPei13zg7FD_h6ICr8FA.text: Who would think you could get a stellar stake in London!  Well, we did!  Service was prompt and very efficient and the steaks were amazing.  I know my steaks and this place did a great job.  Definitely will be back.

WEG0mfSPLo0g3wOn8BosnA.text: A great treat for the family.  Steak was excellent.  Certainly the best I'd had in long time.I think most has been said by those who also gave 5 stars.  Staff are fantastic.  I had a slight problem with the brandy, but without going into detail it was sorted over and above than was required.  Which effectively took £50 off the bill.  Also removed cost of the coffees.Also, first bottle of wine was corked, and couldn't be replaced as no more in stock.  Went for another wine.The highlights of the bill:300 grams - Fillet Steak - £34.95White wine: Verdes Cobardes Blend - £42.50Red wine: Mendel Malbec - £64.00My total bill was £382.50, for two adults, and two very fussy children, who ate adult meals....

a5EKqP3-oRdCBpNv8ZWpKA.text: The starters here are quite good and innovative. Somehow, I must have not been lucky with the beef last couple times I went there. The first time my ribeye came out well done when I ordered it medium rare. The next time I went there, my lomo fillet was cooked as ordered. However, both times I didn't feel like the meat had much flavor to it - tasted a bit bland and metallic. I must confess that I am more used to steaks done the US or European way. I prefer the taste of wood smoke and the searing that comes from an open flame. I don't think its this preference though as I've eaten at other S. American restaurants (see my other reviews) and the beef there has been amazing.I don't want to be unkind, because I know that Gaucho is supposed to be a decent restaurant, but perhaps it has become a bit of chain and lost its original magic? The only reason why I'm so critical is because the prices are high.The ambience at the London Bridge one is goog though and the view across the iconic Tower Bridge at night is amazing.

CaqX0-qIFdr5eXf86oJxyw.text: Love this place. If you want the best Argentine steak in the area, this restaurant is a must! This is their best location.

WK1h-Zw91JkJS5sC5YzYlQ.text: Have been here multiple times. Great meat with a wonderful view outside.

yuU_FKr4NyQoajy3LetCkg.text: Gaucho's has become a bit of a family favourite over the years.  It started by mistake; my dad took me to one near Liverpool St station as we wanted something nice, but close to our train home.  We then started to go to this location near the river, and now, every year, I go again for my birthday (and the occasional other family moment!)Gaucho's trades on Argentinian beef.  There are a set of fantastic cuts, cooked to your liking, together with an enjoyable range of sides.  The sides are a little small; we find it works best to have them as a sharing experience, which works out really well.Personally, I really enjoy the food.  My journey through steak from well to medium has been facilitated by Gaucho's.  The food is always well cooked and the staff are always accommodating and attentive.  The wine selection is also great.As my family has expanded to include 2 young nieces, Gaucho's have continued to accommodate us in a pretty swish restaurant; trust me, that's quite a challenge!Overall, I really enjoy my meals here.  There might be better in the city, there's probably cheaper, but for me, this is a great place for a great steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Gaucho - Tower Bridge - London, United Kingdom

Ason6vRUZaGSfuiAwkQx0A.text: All together, I think I have been to this Gaucho's three times by now. The main reason: The view of Tower Bridge is always mesmerizing for someone who is not from London, which this location is perfect for. I have been here with my wife, my mother and university friends (separate occasions each). We never had issues with any of our steaks or dishes, the staff was always friendly and drinks/wines were good as well. Without the view, I think Gaucho - Tower Bridge could be considered slightly overpriced (however, which fancy restaurant (chain) is not these days in London...)
